title: 30 Best Womenâ€™s Sneakers, According to Celebrities and Editors
description: Being comfortable in your own shoes never goes out of style, so investing in a top-tier sneaker collection is always a smart idea. When it comes to picking out the best sneakers, we look for a few key elements: good sneaker design, quality materials, and the perfect fit - because who wants to be uncomfortable? Our editors test out so many different types of shoes to provide you with the best product recommendations, and we boast a particular expertise on sneakers (call us sneakerheads, if you will). Love some casual, everyday sneakers? We've got you covered. Prefer sportier, performance sneakers for working out? We found those, too. And of course, if you're looking for cute sneakers that you can dress up for work, we've tried our fair share. To help you find the best women's sneakers to add to your wardrobe, we enlisted our expert editors, along with a handful of celebrities we've interviewed - like Kate Hudson, Ashley Graham, and Ayesha Curry - for their masterful recommendations of the best women's sneakers for 2025. These picks cover a range of styles, so you're bound to find your perfect shoe. What to Look For in the Best Women's Sneakers Whether you want something modern and playful or sleek and classic, we've uncovered the best of the best trending this year, and we'll tell you all the reasons we love these stylish sneakers. The styles fall into a number of different design categories, including: best trendy sneakers, best sustainable sneakers, best athletic sneakers, best high-top sneakers, best white sneakers, best classic sneakers, and best sneakers for walking. At the moment, fashion forecasters predict sporty dad sneakers will continue to be big throughout 2025 - particularly styles from brands like New Balance and Adidas. In an homage to the '90s and early aughts, chunky platform sneakers are also being embraced by stylists and celebrities alike - as showcased via New York Fashion Week street style. And the newly debuted Reebok Classic AZ Shoes are primed to be the hottest everyday sneaker this year, thanks to its neutral palette that's easy to style with a range of outfits. Our own sneaker recommendations tout brands like Nike, Converse, Puma, and more. Word of advice: your shoe closet is about to get a whole lot fuller, so make some extra room. Keep reading to shop our guide to the best sneakers for women.
author: Kyley Warren
excerpt: Calling all sneakerheads â€” this shopping guide is just for you! ðŸ‘Ÿ
text: Adidas; New Balance; NikePhoto Illustration: Aly LimAdidas; New Balance; NikePhoto Illustration: Aly LimWhile each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.Being comfortable in your own shoes never goes out of style, so investing in a top-tier sneaker collection is always a smart idea. When it comes to picking out the best sneakers, we look for a few key elements: good sneaker design, quality materials, and the perfect fit â€” because who wants to be uncomfortable? Our editors test out so many different types of shoes to provide you with the best product recommendations, and we boast a particular expertise on sneakers (call us sneakerheads, if you will). Love some casual, everyday sneakers? We've got you covered. Prefer sportier, performance sneakers for working out? We found those, too. And of course, if you're looking for cute sneakers that you can dress up for work, we've tried our fair share. To help you find the best women's sneakers to add to your wardrobe, we enlisted our expert editors, along with a handful of celebrities we've interviewed â€” like Kate Hudson, Ashley Graham, and Ayesha Curry â€” for their masterful recommendations of the best women's sneakers for 2025. These picks cover a range of styles, so you're bound to find your perfect shoe. What to Look For in the Best Women's SneakersWhether you want something modern and playful or sleek and classic, we've uncovered the best of the best trending this year, and we'll tell you all the reasons we love these stylish sneakers. The styles fall into a number of different design categories, including: best trendy sneakers, best sustainable sneakers, best athletic sneakers, best high-top sneakers, best white sneakers, best classic sneakers, and best sneakers for walking. At the moment, fashion forecasters predict sporty dad sneakers will continue to be big throughout 2025 â€” particularly styles from brands like New Balance and Adidas. In an homage to the '90s and early aughts, chunky platform sneakers are also being embraced by stylists and celebrities alike â€” as showcased via New York Fashion Week street style. And the newly debuted Reebok Classic AZ Shoes are primed to be the hottest everyday sneaker this year, thanks to its neutral palette that's easy to style with a range of outfits. Our own sneaker recommendations tout brands like Nike, Converse, Puma, and more. Word of advice: your shoe closet is about to get a whole lot fuller, so make some extra room. Keep reading to shop our guide to the best sneakers for women.01PS Photography | Kyley WarrenBest Cleated SneakersPrettyLittleThing White Chunky Cleated Sole Sneakers ($14, originally $45) For a casual sneaker that you can comfortably wear while you're traveling or running errands, opt for these cleated sneakers from PrettyLittleThing. The chunky shoes have a lifted sole that's designed to provide ample arch support and keep your feet feeling protected while you're on the go. One editor dubbed them as her ultimate "travel sneaker" in this review of the PrettyLittleThing Cleated Sole Sneakers. Editor Quote: "If you're looking for a comfortable shoe that's supportive, provides plenty of cushioning, and is primed for wear from the airport to the hotel and beyond, I can't recommend these comfy sneakers enough. White shoes go with truly everything, meaning you can get away with just packing these for a trip; I love styling them with jeans, dresses, and even a corset and blazer look." â€” Kyley Warren, former assistant editor, Shopping02amazon.comBest Knit SneakersMinnetonka Women's Eco Anew ($20-$80) Offered in nine different unique fabrics and colorways, these Minnetonka shoes are practically a sneaker and slipper in one. The lightweight, breathable fabric comes from recycled water bottles â€” including the laces â€” and the inner and outer sole are also eco-friendly. The shoes are ideal for those with sweat-prone feet who might be in the market for a more breathable option.Editor Quote: "I love a brand that gives back while simultaneously selling a great product, and the purchase of this sneaker plants one tree thanks to a partnership with non-profit company One Tree Planted. These shoes are so soft and comfortable, I don't want to take them off when I return home and walk through the door. They're just as snug as my slippers." â€” Sarah Wasilak, associate content director, Shopping03saucony.comBest Walking SneakersSaucony Integrity Walker 3 ($68, originally $90) These Saucony walking sneakers are considered a neutral silhouette, and they've even received the seal of approval from the American Podiatric Medical Association (casual!). The athletic shoes are made to feel springy with each step, courtesy of their durable upper and outsole design.Editor Quote: "My favorite thing about these walking sneakers is that they come in a range of widths, from narrow to extra wide, and there are half sizes. For me, a shoe that's going to see a lot of mileage needs to hug my foot perfectly, and these interchangeable design elements make that very possible." â€” SW04amazon.comBest Trendy SneakersSuperga 2750 Cotu Classic Sneakers ($45, originally $70) These Superga shoes are a great pair of casual, everyday sneakers. The style has a clean look that can go with practically any clothing item. Best of all, they're easy to clean; simply run them through the wash when they get dirty and you'll have a brand new-looking pair of sneakers in no time. Editor Quote: "I love leather sneakers, but a canvas pair is always good to have on hand, too. Not only are they super easy to throw on with anything from jeans to dresses in spring and summer, but they're also easy to throw in the washing machine and clean, so you'll own them forever." â€” Krista Jones, former editor, Shopping05amazon.comBest Slip-On SneakersSorel Kinetic Impact Strap Shoes ($80-$228) If JoJo Fletcher is a fan of something, then you know it's good. Such is the case with these slip-on shoes, which are perfect for those looking to embrace a less traditional, laced silhouette. The shoe is fitted with a sleek rubber sole and optimizes on its comfortable, laceless design with a stretchy over band that provides flexibility and ease of movement. Celebrity Quote: In this Must Haves feature, Fletcher told PS exclusively that the breathable sneaker is good for any workout, run, or walk. As she put it: "I take them to bootcamp classes, to the gym, and I go on walks with them. I think they're universal sneakers. I also wear these on a leisure day to run errands."06nordstrom.comBest Platform SneakersConverse Chuck Taylor All-Star Platform Sneakers ($70) These Chuck Taylor sneakers have a chunky construction with a platform sole that offers an extra bump â€” literally taking your style game to new heights. The sole upgrades the classic All-Star shoes by giving them a modern refresh that pairs well with practically anything.Editor Quote: "I have always had a pair of converse in my closet. They can go with everything from jeans to dresses. I am loving their recent addition of a platform sole, it gives me a little height and elevates the shoe even more. It is a great twist on the iconic sneaker." â€” Lauren Hendrickson, former vice president, Shopping and Affiliate Growth 07zappos.comBest Retro SneakersReebok Club C 85 Sneakers ($45, originally $75) Featuring a durable and long-lasting leather upper, these Reebok sneakers are not only stylish but also high quality. The shoe's old-school design is timeless, making it a great addition to your closet. Choose from its nine colorways to find a match that best suits you. Editor Quote: "If, like me, you can't stop buying white sneakers, may I suggest you add these Reebok vintage ones to your collection? They are so comfortable and versatile." â€” Alessandra Foresto, former chief of staff, Lifestyle08reebok.comBest Reebok SneakersReebok Classic AZ Shoes ($75) A few days into the new year, and we've already found 2025's hottest shoe: the Reebok Classic AZ. Inspired by the brand's infamous retro Aztec style, this trendy sneaker draws inspiration from the look of '70s running shoes, with a casual silhouette that's easy to dress up or down â€” and a neutral coloring that's endlessly versatile. Supermodel Elsa Hosk donned the cool, Rebook sneaker in a series of photos posted to her Instagram.09amazon.comBest Leather SneakersDolce Vita Zina Sneaker in Metallic Leather ($44-$113) The Zina sneaker is a classic silhouette from Dolce Vita, but in this metallic leather finish, it taps into some of this season's biggest shoe trends, providing your look with an extra eye-catching touch. Our advice? Complement these sneakers with an iridescent bag or sunglasses with reflective lenses to really play up their neat details. With hundreds of Amazon reviews chock full of words of approval, you can't go wrong with these comfy sneakers.10nike.comBest Vintage SneakersNike Blazer Mid '77 Vintage Women's Shoes ($79, originally $105) Retro clothing is a trend right now, so it's no surprise that our editors love these vintage women's sneakers. The classic shoe was originally designed in the late '70s, and its unique style will always be fashionable. We love the high-top shoe's suede accents and old-school Nike lettering on the back.Editor Quote: "I'm a basic millennial at heart and for that reason generally stick to all-white sneakers â€” especially when I'm traveling (which is often) and want shoes that will go with everything. These Nike Blazers are classic enough that I can pair them with anything in my suitcase or closet (dresses, cargo pants, jeans, you name it) but still feel like I'm at least kind of cool, thanks to the hi-top design. Even better: I've thoroughly destroyed them at concerts and walking on dirt roads, and they always wipe clean." â€” Lauren Mazzo, former senior editor, Fitness11PS Photography | Haley LyndesBest Low-Rise SneakersCariuma Off-White Canvas Sneaker ($89) There's nothing better than a classic white shoe, and these off-white sneakers from Cariuma take the style to a whole new level. Not only is this shoe lightweight and incredibly comfortable, but it's made of sustainable materials. Simply throw it in the wash once it's dirty and you'll have a brand-new-looking shoe. Read our Cariuma IBI Low Off-White Knit Sneaker review to learn more.Editor Quote: "Made of bamboo, the Cariuma IBL Low Off-White Knit Sneaker is not only sustainable but extremely comfortable. Its design is as light as a feather and incredibly breathable, so much so, that you don't need to wear socks (although I still do). I wear them everywhere â€” on hot girl walks, grocery shopping, or running errands. These sneakers are my go-to, and they come in tons of color options." â€” Haley Lyndes, former assistant editor, Shopping12amazon.comBest New Balance SneakersNew Balance Women's 574 Core Sneaker ($60-$90) Incorporate a little color into your closet of white sneakers with this New Balance style. The shoe's taupe shade is easy to blend with anything and doesn't dirty as quickly as white shoes do. Plus, it's comfortable and lightweight, making it an attractive grab. Made of recycled polyester, rubber, and bio-based content, these shoes are a great sustainable option you can feel good about wearing â€” for a number of reasons.Editor Quote: "I'm a white sneaker-lover through and through, but recently, even I've discovered the value in owning a few styles that feature a little bit more color. While my Nike Air Force 1s have been my go-to shoe over the last few years, I decided it was finally time to play around with some more versatile colors in my closet, and fell in love with these New Balance 574 Core Sneakers, in the process. These trainers have a super-relaxed fit that makes them easy to throw on and sport for all-day wear. I adore the grey, white, and taupe color palette because it makes the shoe so easy to style." â€” KW13PS Photography | Sarah WasilakBest Canvas SneakersCariuma Black Canvas Low Sneakers ($89) The high-top style of these Cariuma sneakers reminds us of Converse, except with these shoes, two trees are planted for each purchase. The high-top sneakers are available in a variety of color options and have a lightweight design that feels great on the feet. Not to mention, they have a memory insole that molds to the shape of your foot (talk about comfort!). Read our Cariuma Off-White Canvas Sneakers review to learn more. Editor Quote: "My go-to sneaker is, hands down, Cariuma's off-white high-tops. The shade is a perfect neutral and goes with everything, but it's not so bright white that I'm constantly worried about stains and smudges. The vegan brand, started by two best friends from Brazil, crafts its shoes with bamboo and organic cotton and is extremely upfront about production processes." â€” SW14allbirds.comBest Sustainable SneakersAllbirds Wool Runners Sneakers ($98) These cult-favorite running sneakers from Allbirds are one of the sustainable label's most popular styles, and they also happen to be a pair that Bryce Dallas Howard "absolutely adores." The shoes are lightweight, breathable, and great for working out in the winter thanks to their warm and cozy wool. Read about why Howard loves these sneakers, along with her other must-have products.Celebrity Quote: "What I love about Allbirds, in particular, is that there are no logos. And so it gives you a really clean aesthetic look. I mean, I feel like you could wear a pair of Allbirds with a ballgown, honestly, and it's a vibe."15adidas.comBest Adidas SneakersAdidas Stan Smith Shoes ($100) It's hard to go wrong with a classic, and the Adidas Stan Smith Shoes have been around long enough to earn our approval. Their style is minimalist and effortless, making them a great match with athleisure or everyday clothing. Plus, the shoes are now made with recycled materials, so you can feel good about your purchase. These Adidas sneakers are also a favorite of "Queer Eye" star Antoni Porowski, who says "I know that in 15 or 20 years from now when I see myself in photos, I'm still going to be wearing these shoes."Editor Quote: "I practically live in white sneakers, and try as I might, I always come back to Stan Smiths. They're classic for a reason; I've been wearing them since I was a kid, and they've withstood plenty of trend cycles. They go with pretty much everything, and I always want to have a pair in my closet." â€” India Yaffe, former associate editor, Shopping16BackgridCristal RojasBest Classic SneakersAdidas Samba Classic Sneakers ($100) No wardrobe is complete without an everyday sneaker incorporated into it, and these Adidas sneakers come highly recommended by celebrities like Peyton List. The actor detailed her love for the style in an interview with PS, saying that the sneaker doubles as "the perfect everyday shoe." Commerce's associate content director Sarah Wasilak also reviewed the Adidas Samba shoes and re-created celebrity fashion looks in the iconic silhouette. Editor Quote: "My obsession with the Adidas Samba first began in fifth grade. One of my classmates wore the OG classic in black nearly every day, teamed with a pair of Soffe shorts that were rolled precisely three times at the waist. She always beat the boys at soccer during recess. I admired her fashion sense from a young age, and I think that's because she wore her outfits with confidence and exuded a certain toughness â€” especially in her Sambas. It's possible she was even my very first style crush." â€” SW17stevemadden.comBest Chunky SneakersSteve Madden Possession Sneakers ($100) For a style with edge, opt for these chunky sneakers from Steve Madden. The designer shoes play into the season's dad-sneaker trend and boast a heightened design that's sure to elevate any outfit â€” 2.5", to be precise. Shop them in 10 unique colorways, including this neutral variation.18PS Photography | Yerin KimBest Slip-On SneakersKizik Paris Sneaker ($99, originally $135) Slip-on shoes might not have a reputation for being the most stylish sneakers, but these trainers from Kizik prove that they probably should. Fitted with a quick-recovery arc, the comfy shoes are incredibly responsive, with a cushioned sole that provides plenty of bounce back for feet â€” literally helping to put a pep in your step. For the full product details, check out our review of the Kizik Paris Sneaker. Editor Quote: "Kizik's hands-free tech is ideal for those who have limitations that make bending down and tying shoes difficult â€” such as reduced mobility or pregnancy. But they're also great for anyone in search of a comfortable, stylish shoe for daily wear." â€” Yerin Kim, editor, Features19adidas.comBest Trendy SneakersAdidas Campus 00s Shoes ($110) Invest in a sneaker you'll own forever, just like these trendy Adidas Campus 00s. The style pays homage to Adidas's signature stripe design but through a more elevated silhouette that relies on vibrant colors, proportions, and materials. We're confident you'll see these everywhere this season and want to scoop up a pair for yourself.20PS Photography | Anvita ReddyBest Nike SneakersNike Air Force 1 '07 Shoes ($115) The Nike Air Force 1s showcase a simple and timeless look that you can wear forever. The sneaker is based on Nike's '80s version of the same shoe, which proves its look is ageless. Per the brand, it's recommended that if you're between sizes, go a size down. And if you're still not sold on the shoe, these sneakers are a favorite of PS editors â€” just read our review of the Nike Air Force 1 '07 shoes.Editor Quote: "After trying these on myself, I finally understand why the Nike Air Force 1's are the most quintessential white sneakers. They have a casual look yet somehow manage to make you look put together. I love that I can pretty much sport them with the majority of items in my closet, whether it's a flowy summer dress, a cashmere sweater with jeans, a basic bodysuit with jeans, or, of course, athleisure attire." â€” Anvita Reddy, former assitant editor, Shopping21dickssportinggoods.comBest Athletic SneakersUnder Armour Slipspeed Training Shoes ($120) These Under Armour training shoes have a flexible heel that moves with you on the go. Ideal for running, walking, biking, or any activity that involves lots of movement, these sneakers will make your feet feel comforted and supported. Plus, they have cool-to-the-touch foam padding, so your feet will never feel too hot. Editor Quote: "No more dreaded ankle burns from your running sneakers. The Slipspeed is the first shoe with a flexible, contoured heel that instantly (cozily) converts a high-performance speedy pair of kicks into luxury spa slippers." â€” Molly Stout, former executive editor, Lifestyle22nike.comBest Nike Dunk SneakersNike Dunk High Sneakers ($130) Ashley Graham loves a good pair of Nike Dunk High Sneakers. Not only are the shoes stylish, but their bold and defiant tone will upgrade any outfit. Flaunt their high-top design around town and prepare for compliments to roll in. The shoes have been around for 35 years, so they must be doing something right. Read about why Graham loves these sneakers, along with her other must-have products. Celebrity Quote: "They go with dresses, pantsuits. I mean, you can wear them with leggings. You can wear shorts. Just all year round a good pair of high-top sneakers."23nike.comBest Trail Running SneakersNike Zegama 2 Trail Running Shoes ($180) With optimal cushioning and a responsive foam midsole, the Zegama Trail 2 sneaker is built for treks and hikes. This sneaker has a rugged outsole with a deeper lug pattern that grips onto uneven ground. It has the traction to help you conquer rocky trails and steep areas - like tractor tires. The Zegama Trail 2 also has the brand's lightweight ZoomX midsole and an increased stack height, so you can experience a more stable and comfortable stride while maintaining the agility and flexibility you need for rougher terrains.24PS Photography | Charisandra PerezBest Stylish SneakersSoludos The Original Ibiza Shine On Sneakers ($103, originally $149) Made with super soft leather, these platform sneakers require no breaking in. From the minute you put these shoes on you'll be in love, and their soles feel akin to walking on a cloud. The printed sneaker's laces are made from recycled plastic bottles, and its outsoles are made of 20 percent recycled rubber. It's a purchase you can feel good about, which is why we like them so much. Editor Quote: "While I absolutely love the white sneaker trend, I'm too much of a maximalist to ever have been able to commit. Soludos sneakers have the clean aesthetic of a white sneaker with fun designs that really jazz up any outfit. While my most loved pair is no longer available for purchase, I've got the Groovy Wave Ibiza Platform sneakers on my holiday wish list this year." â€” Charisandra Perez, senior distribution strategist25zappos.comBest Waterproof SneakersTeva Terrawave Sneaker ($150) Between the cushy insole and waterproof outer â€” which is made of leather and suede â€” we'd argue that these are the best hiking sneakers, especially for any trails where you might encounter tricky terrain. The shoes are treated with a peppermint-based antimicrobial that fights odors, so they're a spot-on choice for all-day activities.Editor Quote: "Didn't know Teva made sneakers? I didn't either, but this neutral pair has fast become my favorite pair of hiking shoes. While I love how the brown colorway blends in with the environment, they actually look very chic in Blanc, too, and I'm about to invest for less aggressive city days that still involve running a few errands." â€” SW26mgemi.comBest White SneakersM. Gemi Palestra Due Sneakers ($248) It's hard to go wrong with a sneaker that's modern and minimal, and the M. Gemi sneakers feature a clean look that's perfectly stylish. Constructed with flexible leather and a lightweight sole, these sneakers are as comfortable as they get. The shoes are handmade in Tuscany, Italy, so you know they're the real deal.Editor Quote: "I've owned these M. Gemi Palestra sneakers year after year and just purchased them for the third time. Truly, I have never found a sleek white sneaker that I love to wear more. They have this thin and stylish look I wear with literally everything from jeans to trousers and even midi dresses. I rock mine on dates, for weekend walks, and to work. There's nowhere these sneakers don't fit into my wardrobe." Read our M. Gemi Palestra Due Sneakers review to learn more. â€” KJ27nordstrom.comBest Logo SneakersVeja V-10 Sneakers ($170) Crafted of leather, the Veja V-10 Sneakers are a long-lasting shoe that you can pair with practically any outfit. Their lace-up style will keep you secure and comfortable throughout the day and are great for wearing on a walk, running errands, or even to work. Finished with logo lettering, we love the look of this stylish leather sneaker. Editor Quote: "These classic sneakers truly go with everything, and the design will never go out of style." â€” Lisa Sugar, cofounder and former president, PS28PS Photography | Marisa PetrarcaBest Cushioned SneakersOn The Cloudmonster Lightweight Cushioned Running Shoe ($170) In terms of the best sneakers for athletes who are looking to elevate their fitness routine, you really can't go wrong with this cushioned running shoe. The bestselling style is designed with speed in mind, and even helped one PS editor "shed minutes" off her half-marathon PR. Check out our On Cloudmonster Sneakers review for more details. Editor Quote: "Not to be dramatic, but I'm obsessed with these sneakers for training and racing. They have a bouncy responsiveness that I've never experienced with any other sneaker, and for that reason, I'm convinced they're partly due to why I shed a few minutes off my PR. After all, as the name implies, they're born to make you feel like you're running on clouds â€” and they master that sentiment in a way I didn't know possible." â€” Marisa Petrarca, contributing editor, Shopping29PS Photography | Marisa PetrarcaBest Washable SneakersFullup Infinity Cloud White Knit Sneaker ($230) You're not alone if the idea of tossing a comfy pair of white sneakers in the washing machine and having them come out looking brand new sounds like a dream. These ones aren't just easy to clean; they're also a win for sustainability. The knit upper is crafted from 10 recycled plastic bottles, dyed with low-impact colorants, and produced in small batches to minimize waste. Plus, the minimalist knit design will complement everything in your closet. Learn more via our Fullup Infinity Cloud White Knit Sneaker review. Editor Quote: "What I love about these sneakers might be obvious, but it can't be overstated: they're so easy to clean. I wore them to the Minnesota State Fair recently, and all of my friends kept noting how wearing them there (amid the dirt, spilled food and beverages, etc.) was brave. Little did they know that these sneakers were specifically crafted to be machine-washable. After a long day at the event, I got home, removed the insole, threw them in the wash, and left them outside to dry. The result was pristine-looking white sneakers. I can't stress enough that they looked as good as the first day I got them." â€” MP30PS Photography | Jessica HarringtonBest Hiking SneakersBarbour x Flower Mountain Yamano 3 Sneakers ($275) The Barbour x Flower Mountain collab is easily one of the most exciting drops of 2025 so far, blending Barbour's tartan with Flower Mountain's signature floral sneakers. They're built for everything from city strolls to trail hikes, while still looking effortlessly cool for street style moments. Learn more by checking out our Barbour x Flower Mountain Vetted feature, in which multiple editors put the collab to the test. Editor Quote: "My husband and I love hiking on the weekends, but I never have the right shoes. My existing hiking boots are bulky and, frankly, not cute; but if I wear my regular sneakers, more often than not, I slip on uphill parts because they don't have enough traction. I had yet to discover a shoe that strikes the perfect balance until I got a pair of the Barbour x Flower Mountain Yamano 3 Sneakers. Dubbed an 'adventure-ready sneaker,' this shoe has a sleek upper that resembles a street shoe but a thick (yet surprisingly lightweight) rubber sole with tread to conquer all terrain. They're incredibly comfortable, with a size 7 (my normal sneaker size) fitting with enough room to wear thick socks. Plus, the purple and grey colorway taps into that '90s nostalgia and looks so cute, whether I'm in jeans or athleisure." â€” Jessica Harrington, senior editor, BeautyKyley Warren (she/her) is an award-winning writer and editor with more than four years of experience in the publishing space. She previously worked as an assistant editor on PS Shopping and is an expert on all things related to shopping and fashion. Before joining PS, Kyley worked with Entertainment Tonight as a style commerce writer, and her byline has appeared in publications globally.
html:
While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

Being comfortable in your own shoes never goes out of style, so investing in a top-tier sneaker collection is always a smart idea. When it comes to picking out the best sneakers, we look for a few key elements: good sneaker design, quality materials, and the perfect fit â€” because who wants to be uncomfortable? Our editors test out so many different types of shoes to provide you with the best product recommendations, and we boast a particular expertise on sneakers (call us sneakerheads, if you will).

Love some casual, everyday sneakers? We've got you covered. Prefer sportier, performance sneakers for working out? We found those, too. And of course, if you're looking for cute sneakers that you can dress up for work, we've tried our fair share.

To help you find the best women's sneakers to add to your wardrobe, we enlisted our expert editors, along with a handful of celebrities we've interviewed â€” like Kate Hudson, Ashley Graham, and Ayesha Curry â€” for their masterful recommendations of the best women's sneakers for 2025. These picks cover a range of styles, so you're bound to find your perfect shoe.

What to Look For in the Best Women's Sneakers

Whether you want something modern and playful or sleek and classic, we've uncovered the best of the best trending this year, and we'll tell you all the reasons we love these stylish sneakers. The styles fall into a number of different design categories, including: best trendy sneakers, best sustainable sneakers, best athletic sneakers, best high-top sneakers, best white sneakers, best classic sneakers, and best sneakers for walking.

At the moment, fashion forecasters predict sporty dad sneakers will continue to be big throughout 2025 â€” particularly styles from brands like New Balance and Adidas. In an homage to the '90s and early aughts, chunky platform sneakers are also being embraced by stylists and celebrities alike â€” as showcased via New York Fashion Week street style. And the newly debuted Reebok Classic AZ Shoes are primed to be the hottest everyday sneaker this year, thanks to its neutral palette that's easy to style with a range of outfits.

Our own sneaker recommendations tout brands like Nike, Converse, Puma, and more. Word of advice: your shoe closet is about to get a whole lot fuller, so make some extra room. Keep reading to shop our guide to the best sneakers for women.

01

Best Cleated Sneakers

PrettyLittleThing White Chunky Cleated Sole Sneakers ($14, originally $45)

For a casual sneaker that you can comfortably wear while you're traveling or running errands, opt for these cleated sneakers from PrettyLittleThing. The chunky shoes have a lifted sole that's designed to provide ample arch support and keep your feet feeling protected while you're on the go. One editor dubbed them as her ultimate "travel sneaker" in this review of the PrettyLittleThing Cleated Sole Sneakers.

Editor Quote: "If you're looking for a comfortable shoe that's supportive, provides plenty of cushioning, and is primed for wear from the airport to the hotel and beyond, I can't recommend these comfy sneakers enough. White shoes go with truly everything, meaning you can get away with just packing these for a trip; I love styling them with jeans, dresses, and even a corset and blazer look." â€” Kyley Warren, former assistant editor, Shopping

02

Best Knit Sneakers

Minnetonka Women's Eco Anew ($20-$80)

23

Best Trail Running Sneakers

Nike Zegama 2 Trail Running Shoes ($180)

With optimal cushioning and a responsive foam midsole, the Zegama Trail 2 sneaker is built for treks and hikes. This sneaker has a rugged outsole with a deeper lug pattern that grips onto uneven ground. It has the traction to help you conquer rocky trails and steep areas - like tractor tires. The Zegama Trail 2 also has the brand's lightweight ZoomX midsole and an increased stack height, so you can experience a more stable and comfortable stride while maintaining the agility and flexibility you need for rougher terrains.

29

Best Washable Sneakers

Fullup Infinity Cloud White Knit Sneaker ($230)

You're not alone if the idea of tossing a comfy pair of white sneakers in the washing machine and having them come out looking brand new sounds like a dream. These ones aren't just easy to clean; they're also a win for sustainability. The knit upper is crafted from 10 recycled plastic bottles, dyed with low-impact colorants, and produced in small batches to minimize waste. Plus, the minimalist knit design will complement everything in your closet. Learn more via our Fullup Infinity Cloud White Knit Sneaker review.

Editor Quote: "What I love about these sneakers might be obvious, but it can't be overstated: they're so easy to clean. I wore them to the Minnesota State Fair recently, and all of my friends kept noting how wearing them there (amid the dirt, spilled food and beverages, etc.) was brave. Little did they know that these sneakers were specifically crafted to be machine-washable. After a long day at the event, I got home, removed the insole, threw them in the wash, and left them outside to dry. The result was pristine-looking white sneakers. I can't stress enough that they looked as good as the first day I got them." â€” MP

30

Best Hiking Sneakers

Barbour x Flower Mountain Yamano 3 Sneakers ($275)

The Barbour x Flower Mountain collab is easily one of the most exciting drops of 2025 so far, blending Barbour's tartan with Flower Mountain's signature floral sneakers. They're built for everything from city strolls to trail hikes, while still looking effortlessly cool for street style moments. Learn more by checking out our Barbour x Flower Mountain Vetted feature, in which multiple editors put the collab to the test.

Editor Quote: "My husband and I love hiking on the weekends, but I never have the right shoes. My existing hiking boots are bulky and, frankly, not cute; but if I wear my regular sneakers, more often than not, I slip on uphill parts because they don't have enough traction. I had yet to discover a shoe that strikes the perfect balance until I got a pair of the Barbour x Flower Mountain Yamano 3 Sneakers. Dubbed an 'adventure-ready sneaker,' this shoe has a sleek upper that resembles a street shoe but a thick (yet surprisingly lightweight) rubber sole with tread to conquer all terrain. They're incredibly comfortable, with a size 7 (my normal sneaker size) fitting with enough room to wear thick socks. Plus, the purple and grey colorway taps into that '90s nostalgia and looks so cute, whether I'm in jeans or athleisure." â€” Jessica Harrington, senior editor, Beauty
